title: PE Daily: First-Time Funds Return | Petershill Preps Portfolio IPO | Falfurrias' Fast and Furious Fundraising | Patria Eyes Credit Firm Buy
text:
Today's Top Stories

For years, first-time venture fundraising in the U.S. has been on the decline. This year, it's on track to reverse course, Yuliya Chernova writes for WSJ Pro Venture Capital. While megafunds continue to dominate, more debut-fund managers are striking out on their own, emboldened by strong returns in the markets. At the same time, fund investors are looking for ways to back emerging venture firms, which, research shows, tend to outperform the market and be more diverse.

Goldman Sachs Group Inc.'s Petershill Partners said Monday it plans to list an investment vehicle on the London Stock Exchange, taking advantage of a sizzling market for private equity, Julie Steinberg and Ben Dummett report for The Wall Street Journal. The London-based business, which invests in private equity and hedge fund firms that collectively manage $187 billion in assets, is tapping into global investors' desire for juicy returns amid perennially low interest rates. The deal, which would see Petershill's vehicle as a stand-alone company operated by Goldman Sachs Asset Management, could value it at more than $5 billion, said people familiar with the matter.

Falfurrias Capital Partners has raised $850 million for its fifth fund, exceeding the Charlotte, N.C.-based firm's fundraising goal, Chris Cumming reports, citing regulatory filings and people familiar with the offering. The firm launched the vehicle, Falfurrias Capital Partners V LP, with an initial fundraising goal of $800 million, WSJ Pro Private Equity reported this year. The $850 million close is a 70% step up from Falfurrias' previous fund, which closed at its $500 million hard cap in 2019.

Big Number

235,000

The number of jobs the U.S. economy added in August, according to the U.S. Labor Department, falling short of estimates by economists.

Deals

Patria Investments, a Brazilian private-equity manager backed in part by Blackstone Inc., announced an agreement to acquire Chilean firm Moneda Asset Management as it seeks to expand its reach in Latin America and Luis Garcia reported the plan was in the works on Friday for WSJ Pro Private Equity. Patria is buying credit specialist Moneda for US$315 million in cash and stock in a deal that will create a combined firm with about US$26 billion in assets under management.

Los Angeles-based food and agriculture focused investor Butterfly Equity has agreed to take a majority stake in San Diego, Calif.-based Chosen Foods LLC, which creates avocado-based oils, dressings, sauces, guacamole and salsa. Terms of the transaction were not disclosed.

Nashville, Tenn.-based lower midmarket firm Gen Cap America Inc. has acquired laboratory research and animal housing equipment manufacturer Lab Products LLC and metal fabrication company Harford Systems from Avidity Science LLC. The acquisitions form the fourteenth platform company out of Gen Cap's seventh fund, according to a press release.

TowerBrook Capital Partners and NewRoad Capital Partners said they have taken a minority stake in Kevin's Natural Foods, a Modesto, Calif.-based company that offers healthy refrigerated sous vide meat entrees and vegetable side dishes along with sauces and seasonings.

Ferrovial is set to sell its infrastructure-services division to Spanish private-equity company Portobello Capital for around 300 million euros, the equivalent of $356.2 million, Spanish business daily Expansion reports, citing unnamed sources. The Spanish company is in advanced negotiations with Portobello about the division, which includes Ferrovial's services activities that weren't sold to Germany's Schwarz Group in July, Expansion says. The activities sold to Schwarz fetched more than EUR1.1 billion. Ferrovial declined to comment on the report to Dow Jones Newswires.

People

L37 Ventures, a firm that invests across venture capital, private equity and other alternative assets, said it has added two new partners to its ranks. John Tilney and Gregory Park have both joined the firm as general partners. Mr. Tilney previously spent years on the growth investment team at San Francisco-based RS Investments, while Mr. Park's career included experience with Huron Consulting Group, Ernst & Young, CIT Group and Citigroup, according to a press release.

Funds

Asset manager Baring Private Equity Asia is picking up investor capital for its largest ever fund to invest across the Asia-Pacific region, Preeti Singh writes for WSJ Pro. The Hong Kong-based firm's latest fund, Baring Asia Private Equity Fund VIII LP, is targeting $8.5 billion of investor capital, people familiar with the matter said. If the firm reaches that amount, the new fund would be nearly 31% larger than its predecessor, which wrapped up with $6.5 billion in 2019.

Stockholm-based private equity firm Trill Impact, an independent private investment firm backed by Nordea Asset Management, has announced it has closed €900 million in commitments, the equivalent of $1.07 billion, for its inaugural impact mid-market buyout fund, Lina Saigol writes for sister publication Private Equity News. Trill Impact was founded in 2019 as a joint venture between former EQT partner Jan Ståhlberg and Nordea Asset Management to invest in non-listed companies with strong sustainability targets. The firm has more than €1 billion in assets under management across its private equity and microfinance investment advisory strategies.

Industry News

Chinese state investors are looking to take an ownership stake in ride-hailing giant Didi Global Inc., months after regulators punished the company with restrictions and made it one of the highest-profile casualties of China's toughening stance on tech, Quentin Webb and Lingling Wei write for the Journal. The municipal government in Beijing is coordinating a proposed investment by a consortium of state-backed companies that includes a competing ride-hailing service, a person familiar with the matter said.

Spok Holdings, Inc., a healthcare communications company listed on the Nasdaq stock exchange, said it has tapped advisors to help it conduct a strategic review of potential transactions, including a possible sale of the company. Spok said it decided to disclose the review process in light of public expression of interest in acquiring the company and the purchase of more than 5% of its outstanding stock by Acadia Research Corporation and its partner hedge firm Starboard Value LP.
